RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 89. Starter Allowance Purse 24000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE MARCH 1, 2021. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since January 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where E ntered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAYJAYDEE stalked the early pace then challenged approaching the three eighths pole, took the nod two deep passing the quarter pole, drew clear nearing the head of the lane and drew off under a vigorous hand ride. RAISE A SPEIGHTS rated a short lead inside, came under pressure approaching the seven sixteenths pole, was met at even terms nearing the quarter and gave up the nod, dropped back toward the head of the lane and settled for second best. SHANGHAI CANDY rated close off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for third. CANTAKEITANYMORE settled off the pace in the three and four paths, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little more. JAMMIN JIMTOWN rated close to the early pace in the four path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened in the lane. GOLDEN APPEAL rated close for about a half mile then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Jammin Jimtown
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IT'S A REAL HONOR was bumped shortly after the start then gave chase, contested a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, dueled for the lead past the eighth pole, lugged in through the upper stretch but drew clear a sixteenth away and held on well. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE was jostled then forced outward and into Far More shortly after the break, gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn about the three path, bore out into the lane but dug in to take second the final strides. LAS VEGAS BLVD quickly cleared her rivals and angled to the inside, rounded the turn near the rail, was met leaving the eighth pole and flattened inside the sixteenth. SHY BELLA chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. TAPTAP gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, eased out toward the head of the lane and showed little further. FAR MORE broke in and made contact with Knobiesmagicsonde, was then forced outward and into It's A Real Honor then chased outside, raced in the five path of the turn and weakened in the lane. LAURA'S GRAND broke outward and into Knobiesmagicsonde then gave chase and saved ground on the turn. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed claims of foul against the rider of It's A Real Honor for alleged interference at the start, lodged by the riders of Knobiesmagicsonde and Far More.

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,forced out,bumped,3p turn,bore out 1/8,up 2nd late

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Robert B. Laster & Melissa A. Mellott

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winner s Of A Race Since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY LOVELY GIRL settled off the early pace, bid approaching the three eighths pole and took the lead three wide midway on the turn, dueled clear inside the sixteenth pole and held on well. MANAROLA gave chase and rounded the turn in the three and four paths, eased out leaving the turn and finished well to take second the final yards. ALWAYS SOMETHING took the lead leaving the chute and set a pressured pace, was met at even terms at the quarter pole, gave up the nod at the rail midway on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. TIZ THE REASON pressured the pace and dueled to even terms at the quarter pole, contested the turn two deep but weakened the final sixteenth. SUPER WILDCAT gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. THUNDER PUNCH gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened inside the sixteenth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: My Lovely Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace,bid 3/8,up 3wd mid turn,dueled clear later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 13800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GANDHI'S ORION bobbled at the break then took over and moved to the inside midway on the opening turn, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the lane. WICKOSITY was bumped at the break and settled off the pace about the three path, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail but drifted into the lane and settled for second best. OBOY settled off the rail, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and improved near the rail on the far turn, but showed little more. D'LUCCI BOY exchanged contact with Positraction leaving the gate then stalked the early pace, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and faded off the rail on the far turn. POSITRACTION ran loose in the post parade and saved ground. FLAT BUSTED broke outward and made contact with Wickosity then settled off the early pace about the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. LIGHT WORK saved ground off the early pace, eased out with a bid into the backstretch and rounded the far turn about the three path.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 1 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STEAL THE CASH saved early ground then eased outward into the backstretch, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole, steadily improved in the three path of the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and dueled clear later yards. OVERLY CRITICAL stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took a slim lead three wide passing the quarter, but was met toward mid-stretch and settled for second. SEAN THE HAMMER closed to even terms two deep at the nine sixteenths pole and rated with the pace, dueled Bubba G leaving the three eighths, was met past the quarter and continued close at the rail on the far turn, though, flattened the final sixteenth. MIMS HAT TRICK was forced outward leaving the gate then saved early ground, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, eased to the four path approaching the head of the lane and flattened in the lane. ROCKIN THE PALACE rounded the first turn in the two and three paths, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little more. BUBBA G veered out leaving the gate then set the early pace inside, was met at the nine sixteenths pole and rated with Sean The Hammer from that point, dueled that one leaving the three eighths pole but dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened. MOSLEY NATURAL was shuffled back early, rounded the opening turn in the four path then saved ground on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Mosley Natural
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back ealry,4p 1st turn,saved ground far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Claiming Purse 21200. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, For Each $2,500 To $10,000 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHAKE IT GIRL veered out leaving the gate then gave chase, took the nod two deep leaving the turn, dueled clear toward mid-stretch and held well under steady handling. LILY MOR pressured the pace and raced close at the rail on the turn, lacked room off the heels of Blue Agave approaching the eighth pole but finished strong and dueled through the stretch for second. SUPER MONEY came away awkwardly and a step slow then gave chase, raced in the three path of the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. SUPER SWEETIE chased the pace and raced close in the four path of the turn, drifted leaving the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. GOT MORE chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path of the turn and finished well. PARISIAN SUMMER chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. BLUE AGAVE set a pressured early pace and contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, but was met leaving the turn and weakened. LADY IN WAITING steadied at the start and saved ground.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since F ebruary 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOZY'S WILDCAT rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole and contested the edge at the rail into the far turn, dueled clear of Downtownchalybrown approaching the eighth pole and was steadily handled through the lane. BAR FOURTEEN saved ground off the pace, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and was eased outward approaching the top of the lane, came between horses mid-stretch and dug in to take second the final strides. JACKIE A rated close off the rail into the first turn, gave chase from the nine sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn but flattened stride nearing the wire. DOWNTOWNCHALYBROWN closed to contention while tapering in on the opening turn and raced with the early pace, gave chase from the three eighths pole and raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn before weakening. FLATTER ME PLEASE rounded the first turn about the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. PIONEER SPIRIT rounded the first turn about the four path and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Jackie A
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,chased 9/16,rail far turn,flattened final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 20600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,25 0 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRANDIOSELY was shuffled back shortly after the start and settled off the early pace, started a bid between horses leaving the three eighths pole, took the nod two deep midway on the turn and dug in determinedly to inch further ahead of UNLOCK in later strides, while the latter gave chase toward the inside, steadied between horses while at a slim disadvantage midway on the turn and dueled gamely before yielding; grudgingly. DIAMONDS N DENIM chased the early pace toward the outside, rounded the turn about the four path, dug in from the head of the lane to clear third in later yards and was gaining on the top two. SHANIA SEA set a pressured pace, contested the advantage off the rail on the turn, angled out leaving the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. FEAR THE DIVA steadied between horses approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little further. DISTORTED SPLENDOR gave chase through the backstretch and saved ground on the turn. LECTRIC ROD gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. LADY LICIOUS gave chase well off the rail and rounded the turn about the five path.

ENTRY.NAME: Unlock
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,close rail turn,gamely lane,grudgingly ceded

ENTRY.NAME: Grandiosely
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled early,bid between 3/8,up 2d mid turn,determined effort

ENTRY.NAME: Shania Sea
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,off rail turn,angled out 1/8,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Diamonds N Denim
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,4p turn,dug in lane,clear 3rd late,gaining top two
